StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [sp_DeleteSMCR]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@SMCRID int, @UserLogin varchar(15) AS
SET NOCOUNT ON
DECLARE @DBID int DECLARE @DBNAME sysname DECLARE @ErrMsg varchar(100)
--- INITIALIZE VARIABLES SELECT @DBID = DB_ID(), @DBNAME = DB_NAME()
IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM SMCR WHERE SMCR_ID = @SMCRID) BEGIN --- DELETE THE RECORD DELETE FROM SMCR WHERE SMCR_ID = @SMCRID
IF @@ROWCOUNT != 1 BEGIN SET @ErrMsg = 'An error occurred dele.ng the SMCR record for this applicant.' RAISERROR (@ErrMsg, 16, 2, @DBID, @DBNAME) RETURN END END
IF @@ERROR != 0 BEGIN SET @ErrMsg = 'An error occurred dele.ng the SMCR record for this applicant.' RAISERROR (@ErrMsg, 16, 3, @DBID, @DBNAME) RETURN END
SET NOCOUNT OFF
